snippet: A government official is to testify Wednesday that protection of radioactive medical materials is inadequate, with non-security personnel like physicists sometimes charged with enforcing regulations.
abstract: Government Accountability Office official will testify at Senate Homeland Security subcommittee that protection of radioactive medical materials in hospitals is inadequate, with non-security personnel like physicists sometimes charged with enforcing regulations.
lead_paragraph: A government official is to testify Wednesday that protection of radioactive medical materials is inadequate, with non-security personnel like physicists sometimes charged with enforcing regulations.

headline.seo: Hospital Audit Finds Radioactive Materials Unsecured
headline.main: Hospitals With Radioactive Materials Expose Weakness in Antiterror Rules
headline.print_headline: Hospitals With Radioactive Materials Expose Weakness in Antiterror Rules
